Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter randomized controlled trial was conducted at 11 university hospitals in Germany.

Participants.evidence: Patients aged ≥18 years undergoing major abdominal surgery

Intervention.evidence: experimental group (FT with visible screen and step goals) or control group (FT with blackened screen)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative morbidity within 30 days, measured by the Comprehensive Complication Index (CCI).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was web-based with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: neither patients nor outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 347 patients were recruited between June 2019 and October 2021, with 174 in the experimental group and 173 in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean CCI was 23±24 in the experimental group and 22±22 in the control group (95% CI: −6.1, 3.7; P=0.628).

Harms.evidence: Serious adverse events occurred in 20% of the experimental group and 25% of the control group (P=0.237).

Funding.evidence: Conducted by the Student-Initiated German Medical Audit (SIGMA) study group.
